definition: to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
surname Xing

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: This is the ancient origins of the rise of Buddhism and Taoism in the pre-existing folk activities.
sentences.chinese: 这是源流古者在佛道教兴起前就有的民俗活动。

sentences.english: Summary: What does rise of the Tea Party movement mean for U.
sentences.chinese: 茶党运动的兴起对美国外交政策意味着什么呢？

sentences.english: Hundred Years' Translation Movement began to arise in Abbasid Dynasty of Arab in the Middle Ages.
sentences.chinese: 百年翻译运动兴起于中世纪阿拉伯的阿拔斯王朝。

sentences.english: What have you gained — or lost — from the internet’s rise?
sentences.chinese: 您从互联网的兴起获得什么或者失去什么？

sentences.english: Binxing is a kind of etiquette for commending and learning encouragement, which is origin from "Zhou".
sentences.chinese: 宾兴起源于《周礼》，是一种表彰和劝学的礼仪。

sentences.english: Later, when metaphysics and buddhism arose in Wei Jin period, the shape and bearing of an object.
sentences.chinese: 魏晋时期玄佛兴起，理沟通了形与神。

sentences.english: The article content is divided into three parts:Part one, the rise of the constitutionalism group at the beginning of the 20th century.
sentences.chinese: 第一部分，20世纪初立宪派的兴起。

sentences.english: The just said rise also doesn't feel, just discover a cool idea set of now person.
sentences.chinese: 刚才说的兴起还不觉得，现在才发现凉意袭人。

sentences.english: King Xerxes had a mad thought in his drunken state.
sentences.chinese: 满是醉意的亚哈随鲁王突然兴起一个疯狂的念头。

sentences.english: Living in the countryside was only Patricia's passing fancy.
sentences.chinese: 到乡村定居不过是帕里西夏一时兴起的想法。

sentences.english: The "reality TV" is a new kind entertainment on telescreen .
sentences.chinese: 真人秀是近年来在电视屏幕上兴起的新的娱乐形式。

sentences.english: Lockard sent the package anonymously, just on a whim.
sentences.chinese: 因此洛卡德先生一时兴起，寄送了一个匿名的包裹。

sentences.english: Stand Up, stand up for Jesus, Ye soldiers of the cross;
sentences.chinese: 兴起兴起为耶稣十架忠勇精兵。

sentences.english: Stand Up, stand up for Jesus, Ye soldiers of the cross;
sentences.chinese: 兴起兴起为耶稣十架忠勇精兵。

sentences.english: Non-silicon-based ordered mesoporous materials in recent years has been the emergence of a new research focus.
sentences.chinese: 非硅基有序介孔材料是近年来新兴起的一个研究热点。

sentences.english: WEB-based simulation is a new branch of simulation technology.
sentences.chinese: 基于WEB的仿真是一门刚刚兴起的仿真技术分支。

definition: to rise suddenly/to grow vigorously
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
to be in vogue/to be prevalent
to develop rapidly
tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
to flourish/to thrive
Xinxing county in Yunfu 雲浮|云浮[Yun2 fu2], Guangdong/Xinxing or Hsinhsing district of Kaohsiung city 高雄市[Gao1 xiong2 shi4], south Taiwan
(of markets, industries, infectious diseases etc) rising/emerging/in the ascendant
upsurge/popular craze
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
rampant/very popular
(literary) to decline/to wane/title of a section in the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1]
wave/tides
to be popular for a while/to be all the rage for a time
to emerge to meet a historic destiny (idiom)/to arise at an opportune time/able to take advantage of an opportunity/to rise to the occasion
to fall/to drop/to decline/to deteriorate/to go downhill
to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
